title: Shark attack dad saved by heroic pals after they drag him from the water after he's bitten several times

Heroic pals save a young father's life after they dragged him from the water after he was mauled by a shark . 
Dad-of-two Glenn Dickson is fighting for his life after he was repeatedly bitten by the predator just off Hinchinbrook Island, Australia, this morning. 
Horrified witnesses said the 26-year-old lost a lot of blood after the animal snapped down on his legs and hip. 
But he was saved by his quick-thinking friends who dragged him back to a boat before applying a tourniquet to stop the excessive bleeding, according to Seven News . The 26-year-old Cairns man is in a critical but stable condition in hospital (Photo: FACEBOOK) Horrified witnesses said the 26-year-old lost a lot of blood after the animal snapped down on his legs and hip (Photo: FACEBOOK) Mr Dickson was saved by his quick-thinking friends who dragged him back to a boat (Photo: FACEBOOK) 
They then raced him to the mainland town of Cardwell 30kms away, where he was seen by ambulance crews, who rushed him Cairns Hospital. 
Friends said Mr Dickson was attacked by either a tiger shark or bull shark while he was spearfishing off the far north Queensland island. Read More Monster great white shark feared to be prowling Brit waters after mutilated corpses found washed up on shore 
Initial reports from the Cairns Post said he was attacked the moment he hit the water – after jumping from a rock near a boat ramp. 
A Queensland Ambulance spokeswoman said paramedics treated him for serious leg injuries and severe blood loss after he sustained multiple bites to his upper and lower leg. 
One paramedic said it was one of the most difficult cases they've ever dealt with. Mr Dickson was attacked the moment he hit the water – after jumping from a rock near a boat ramp (Photo: FACEBOOK) He is currently in surgery in Cairns Hospital (Photo: FACEBOOK) Witnesses said a bull shark, pictured, could've attacked Mr Dickson (Photo: Getty) 
An officer in charge of the Cardwell ambulance station said the man's friends had “definitely” saved his life. 
“The patient in question was spear fishing on one of the reefs outside Cardwell and he was in the water with three friends (when attacked),” Martin Taylor told the Townsville Bulletin . Read More 
“The friends have immediately pulled him out of the water and applied emergency first aid – a tourniquet high and tight around his femur – and stopped the subsequent bleeding, which was quite significant.” Glenn Dickson was bitten by a shark just off Hinchinbrook Island Friends One paramedic said it was one of the most difficult cases they've ever dealt with (Photo: FACEBOOK) Swimmers also thought a tiger shark could have attacked the father-of-two (Photo: Linda McKean/UPY2017) 
“From what I’ve been told, he was in the water, he’s been hit, they’ve heard a noise, they’ve dragged him in as soon as they’ve realised what’s gone on,” he said. 
“The initial actions by the three friends have definitely saved this gentleman’s life.” 
Mr Dickson, from Mission Beach, Australia, is currently in surgery in Cairns Hospital. Like us on Facebook
